poem:
"On the Fringes of Promises Made"

Starmer sketches borders with words,
In manifestos, hopes are unfurled.
In the heartlands of Labour stirred,
An echo of a far-flung world.
Statehood pledged before the peace,
An affirmation pre-endgame cease.
Bearing witness to silenced pain,
Knowing promises are footprints in rain.
Horse before cart, the listeners glean,
To keep afloat a left-wing dream.
